article.description: Isaiah Zierden scored 17 points with five 3-pointers and Creighton shot 68 percent in the second half to cruise past IUPUI 90-65 on Saturday to win their second straight.
article.headline: Creighton cruises past IUPUI 90-65
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. -- Isaiah Zierden scored 17 points with five 3-pointers and Creighton shot 68 percent in the second half to cruise past IUPUI 90-65 on Saturday to win their second straight. Khyri Thomas scored 13 points on 5-of-6 shooting, Toby Hegner had 12 with four 3s, and Zach Hanson added 11. Maurice Watson Jr. had 10 assists. The Blue Jays (7-3) made 12 of 21 3-pointers (57 percent) and outscored the Jaguars on fast breaks 16-4. Up 40-29 at halftime, Creighton used a 17-2 run to pull to a 71-47 lead on a 3-pointer by James Milliken with 9:21 to play. Milliken extended Creighton's lead to 26 with a layup with 4:55 left and the Blue Jays stayed in control. Khyri Thomas opened the game with a layup and Creighton never trailed. Darell Combs scored 19 for IUPUI (3-9) and Matt O'Leary added 14.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
